quest.name: The Price of Principles
journal: Minfilia appears to be lost in thought.

Ever since your famous victory over Gaius van Baelsar, the halls of the Waking Sands have been thronged with petitioners seeking to engage the Scions' services for personal gain. Although Minfilia is loath to entertain their dubious proposals, she wonders if accepting such patronage might ultimately empower the order to do greater good. Before making any decision, she would like to hear the opinions of your fellow Scions. Speak with Thancred, Y'shtola, Yda, Papalymo, and Urianger.
As expected, the other Scions are deeply concerned about the ideological implications of accepting conditional support. Perhaps Alphinaud can offer a different perspective on the matter?

Alphinaud seizes the opportunity to make a bold counter-proposal: move the Scions' headquarters to Mor Dhona, beyond the borders of Ul'dah and the other great nations. Though Minfilia makes a show of listening to the young Elezen's reasoning, she is not to be convinced, decrying his idea as reckless beyond words before unceremoniously dismissing him. As you silently watch Alphinaud take his leave, you sense that, beneath their heated words, another conversation was taking place...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...Hm? Forename. It pleases me to see you well.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Do excuse me for interrupting, Forename. My lady, the gentleman from Ashgana Exports has just left.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: <sigh> I understand now why you didn't want to receive him.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You did well, Tataru. Please inform the guards that we will not be receiving any further guests this eveningmorningafternoon.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Thank you, my lady!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Ever since we defeated Gaius van Baelsar and destroyed his ultimate weapon, the eyes of the world have followed our every move, scarce remembering to blink.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Where once we worked in secret─with precious few friends and all too many enemies─we are now besieged by benefactors, each one more eager than the last to offer us his complete support.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: A true embarrassment of riches...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of course, every promise of patronage comes with a price.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Some make their intentions known from the start, while others endeavor to engage us more subtly. Dress it how they will, the message is ever the same: we shall help you, but only if you help us.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The gentleman Tataru spoke of was more brazen than most. In exchange for certain supplies, he would have us resolve a business dispute.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Naturally, I refused him, as I have every other merchant of his ilk... Alas, the Syndicate's overtures are not so easily rejected...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: When we formed the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, it was with the goal of serving Eorzea, not the interests of individual Eorzeans. Our neutrality is fundamental to our cause.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: In my heart, I know this to be true, and yet... And yet... If accepting these offers of patronage could empower us to do greater good, might they not warrant greater consideration?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Our Baldesion colleagues have been generous beyond measure, but we cannot expect them to─

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Forgive me. I did not mean to burden you so.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yet...my urge to share this dilemma may not be wholly misguided... Might I impose upon you to consult the others? They are like to have their own opinions on this matter.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I confess, I am...conflicted. It may be wise to consult with the others.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Fortune begets power, and power fortune. That we─and especially you─have power is beyond doubt. The question is what to do with it...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: You may be interested to know that there is a growing belief amongst the refugees that Ala Mhigo could be liberated...if only the Scions would commit their strength to the cause.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Yet theirs is but one of many causes. We stand at a crossroads, Forename. Each path is paved with good intentions, but where they lead is far from clear.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Recall you our meeting with the Admiral, shortly after the Lominsans sent word of the summoning of Titan?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then mayhap you also recall my words to our host. I said unto Merlwyb that her people had broken their treaty with the kobolds, and that the beastmen had justly responded─that we had been called to intervene in a conflict which she herself had invited. I spoke, in short, the truth.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And wherefore did I speak it? Because, owing no allegiance to Limsa, I felt no compulsion to allow the Lominsans to distort the facts to fit a narrative which justified their actions and absolved them of guilt.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Upon this subject, Minfilia can expect a similar reply. Our many dalliances with the city–states have already weakened our claim to neutrality, but the path she contemplates would see us relinquish it entirely.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: None can deny that we would benefit from more support, but if it comes at the cost of our principles?

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Neutrality was ever a delicate matter. I've lost count of the times I've had to explain to people that our allegiances need not necessarily lie in the same place as our headquarters. Mind you, if we are to sell our services for gil, we might as well declare our fealty to Ul'dah now, and have done with it. I'm quite sure Yda would enjoy the bribes...

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: I've been receiving a lot of gifts lately, but Papalymo keeps making me send them back.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: It wouldn't be so bad, but some of them are really nice! I mean, very nearly abandon-your-principles nice, you know?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis the lot of the powerful to attract the covetous as well as the needy. Thus doth prudence dictate that those with power proffer aid with one hand whilst the other resteth ever on their hilt.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Alas, we have not the luxury of time to decipher our petitioners' machinations─nay, not while the beast tribes do labor unseen, defiant in defeat, to raise up their fallen primals once more.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Doubt not that they shall return─stronger and bolder both─nor that we shall be the ones to meet them. This sacred charge shall ever be ours. 'Tis but a pity we are so few, and our fortune so finite...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hm. This situation is not wholly unexpected.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I too have given much thought to our organization's future...though it would seem I have reached a different conclusion.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Mayhap it is time I made my feelings known to the Antecedent. Come along, Forename.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Alphinaud, Forename? Is aught amiss?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You desired counsel, and so you shall have it. Minfilia─the Scions of the Seventh Dawn must leave Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: We must do what?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So long as we remain within Ul'dahn territory, we will never be free to act with impunity.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Moving our headquarters to Vesper Bay only delayed the inevitable.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We have demonstrated our capabilities, and the Syndicate has taken note. They will not suffer our organization to remain independent now. We are far too dangerous for that.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Surely you realize they are the reason Vesper Bay still lacks an aetheryte?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: They know full well how beneficial one would be to our cause...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Which is why it and other favors will be denied us unless we cooperate.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: If Ul'dah is no longer suitable, where would you have us go?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Experience has taught us that the appearance of neutrality is as important as the reality.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Accordingly, we must keep each of the great nations at arm's length, and plant our banner in a place which all agree to be beyond their borders.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Mor Dhona.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Revenant's Toll, to be precise. It lies within neutral territory, and offers all the essential facilities we require. By way of an additional benefit, it is also frequented by a veritable legion of adventurers who may serve to supplement our ranks.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I am, of course, conscious of the fact that we have developed a certain bond with Ul'dah and her people over the years...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But I truly believe this to be the best course of action.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: As you yourself observed, we have invaluable ties to the local community, forged through years of concerted effort. Ul'dah...Ul'dah is our home, Alphinaud! To cast aside everything we have built and start anew in that desolate wasteland would be beyond reckless!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The decision is yours to make, Antecedent. I ask only that you recall the shared purpose which first moved us to found the Scions of the Seventh Dawn─and which moved you to found the Path of the Twelve ere that.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We aspire to an ideal, you and I. Just as my grandfather did. That makes us more than mere comrades-in-arms.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We are as much your family as─

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: That will be all, Alphinaud.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I am sure you have some familial affairs of your own to attend to.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Your concern is most generous, but no─I have left them in the hands of men better suited to the task than I. I could not very well allow my personal affairs to come before the needs of the order, after all.
